chapter.title: Design Overview
chapter.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; has modular design. Each protocol has its own separate module. This module depends only on its provider - that is for instance SCCP depends only from MTP and TCAP depends on SCPP. This makes it easy to customize whole &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION;. Specific protocol module has list of all dependencies along with information on general design. Please refer to module description for more information.

listitem.para: Linkset is logical shortcut. This term hides MTP layer, ie. it abstracts wheather hardware MTP is used or &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; one.
Usually Linkset will be deployed as part of &THIS.PLATFORM; Media Server deployment.

Shell is tool which allows to manage different aspects of &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; in interactive manner. It connects to different entities which manage Linksets or SCCP routing for instance. For detailed information please refer to: . Usually Shell will be invoked from remote machine(remote to Linksets and application protocols).

M3UA stands for MTP Level 3 (MTP3) User Adaptation. Its main purpose is to provide routing, management and streaming of MSUs(message signaling units) between different peers. &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; has dedicated M3UA implementation. It connects Linkests with application level protocols(such as SCCP or ISUP).
Application term encapsulates not only application level protocols(such as SCCP or ISUP) but also entities which make use of them(like SLEE RA & Service)
